placeholder.heading: Council authorized to establish charges for sanitary sewer service.

level.heading: History
level.text: (May 18, 1954, 68 Stat. 106, ch. 218, title II, § 206; Jan. 22, 1976, D.C. Law 1-42, § 3(f)(4), 22 DCR 6314; repealed pursuant to § 303 of D.C. Law 11-111.)

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-111
level.text: Law 11-111, the "Water and Sewer Authority Establishment and Department of Public Works Reorganization Act of 1996," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-102, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 7, 1995, and January 4, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 31, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-201 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-111 became effective on April 18, 1996.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Repeal effective 90 days after meeting of Board: Section 303 of D.C. Law 11-111 repealed this section. However, § 601 of D.C. Law 11-111 provided that title III of the act shall apply 90 days after the initial meeting of the Board established by section 204 of the act.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-111
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-111, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 34-2104.
